thread.title: Local college roundup: CGA football comes back to post win
thread.title_full: Local college roundup: CGA football comes back to post win

author: The Bulletin
title: Local college roundup: CGA football comes back to post win
text: • H.S. roundup: Quinebaug Valley defeats Wilcox Tech CASTINE, Maine — Mark Behne picked off a pass in the end zone with 40 seconds left in the fourth quarter, his second of the period and the third for Coast Guard Academy in a 21-14 comeback win over Maine Maritime in New England Football Conference action on Saturday afternoon. The Bears (3-2, 2-0) overcame a 14-0 deficit with two touchdowns in a 42-second span in the second quarter. After Mike Clancy finished off a 10-play, 67-yard drive with a 3-yard touchdown run, Coast Guard recovered the ensuing kickoff after the wind knocked it down and it went untouched by Maine Maritime. Three plays later, quarterback Derek Victory hit Kyle Jackson for a 37-yard touchdown to tie the game. Coast Guard took the lead for good on a 7-yard pass from Victory to Jordan Groff early in the fourth quarter. MEN’S SOCCER Mitchell 7 Southern Vermont 0 NEW LONDON — NFA alum Cody Poirier scored his first goal of the season to help the Mariners earn the win. Andrew Storton, the Bacon Academy boys soccer coach, and Waterford alum Yianni Longinidis also scored and Andrew Nigro recorded a hat trick for Mitchell (4-5-1, 2-0-0 New England Collegiate Conference). WOMEN’S SOCCER ECSU 1 Keene St. 0 KEENE, N.H. — Woodstock Academy alum Emily Becher scored her team-best seventh goal of the season and it was enough to give the Warriors the win. East Lyme grad Rachel Skelton made five saves to earn the shutout for Eastern Connecticut State (8-2-1, 4-0-0 Little East). FIELD HOCKEY UConn 10 Villanova 0 STORRS — Roisin Upton had a hat trick and two assists to lead the top-ranked Huskies to victory in their Big East opener. Anna Middendorf scored twice and Casey Umstead added a goal and an assist for UConn (10-0, 1-0). Worcester St. 3 ECSU 2 WORCESTER, Mass. — Gabriela Meza scored her first goal of the season but it was not enough to lift the Warriors. Laura Chicorka also scored for Eastern (5-4, 3-2 LEC). WOMEN’S ICE HOCKEY UConn 2 Union 2 (OT) STORRS — Brittany Berisoff scored in the third period to help the Huskies earn a tie in their home opener. Caitlin Hewes scored in the second period to help UConn (0-1-1) rally from a 2-0 deficit. VOLLEYBALL Warriors split WILLIMANTIC — Eastern Connecticut State lost it first match of the Crabtree Tri-Match to Smith, 3-2 (25-23, 25-15, 25-21, 25-10, 15-7) before rallying to sweep John Jay, 3-0 (25-14, 25-9, 25-15). Page 2 of 2 - In the first match, Waterford alum Amanda Tourjee dished out 11 assists and Adrianna Mihalek had 17 kills. In the second match, Tourjee added another 13 assists to go along with five digs. Kay Mullen added seven kills and Nina Zimmitti added 10 digs and four aces for the Warriors (8-8). By The Bulletin
